t: John 13
The Lord’s Supper

Now*p before the Feast of the Passover, Jesus knowing that His hour had come that He would depart out of this world to the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.
During supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, the*i son*i of Simon, to betray Him,
Jesus,*i knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands, and that He had come forth from God and was going back to God,
got up from supper, and laid aside His garments; and taking a towel, He girded Himself.
Jesus Washes the Disciples’ Feet
Then*p He poured water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel with which He was girded.
So He came to Simon Peter. He said to Him, “Lord, do You wash my feet?”
Jesus answered and said to him, “What*r I*r do*r you*r do*r not*r realize*r now,*r but*r you*r will*r understand*r hereafter.”*r
Peter said to Him, “Never shall You wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If*r I*r do*r not*r wash*r you,*r you*r have*r no*r part*r with*r Me.”*r
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, then*i wash*i not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.”
Jesus said to him, “He*r who*r has*r bathed*r needs*r only*r to*r wash*r his*r feet,*r but*r is*r completely*r clean;*r and*r you*r are*r clean,*r but*r not*r all*r of*ir you.”*ir
For He knew the one who was betraying Him; for this reason He said, “Not*r all*r of*r you*r are*r clean.”*r
So*p when He had washed their feet, and taken His garments and reclined at*i the*i table*i again, He said to them, “Do*r you*r know*r what*r I*r have*r done*r to*r you?*r
You*r call*r Me*r Teacher*r and*r Lord;*r and*r you*r are*r right,*r for*r so*ir I*r am.*r
If*r I*r then,*r the*r Lord*r and*r the*r Teacher,*r washed*r your*r feet,*r you*r also*r ought*r to*r wash*r one*r another’s*r feet.*r
For*r I*r gave*r you*r an*r example*r that*r you*r also*r should*r do*r as*r I*r did*r to*r you.*r
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r a*r slave*r is*r not*r greater*r than*r his*r master,*r nor*r is*ir one*r who*r is*r sent*r greater*r than*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r him.*r
If*r you*r know*r these*r things,*r you*r are*r blessed*r if*r you*r do*r them.*r

I*r do*r not*r speak*r of*r all*r of*r you.*r I*r know*r the*r ones*r I*r have*r chosen;*r but*r it*ir is*ir that*r the*r Scripture*r may*r be*r fulfilled,*r ‘He*sr who*sr eats*sr My*sr bread*sr has*sr lifted*sr up*sr his*sr heel*sr against*sr Me.’*sr
From*r now*r on*r I*r am*r telling*r you*r before*r it*ir comes*r to*r pass,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r does*r occur,*r you*r may*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r He.*ir
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r he*r who*r receives*r whomever*r I*r send*r receives*r Me;*r and*r he*r who*r receives*r Me*r receives*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.”*r
Jesus Predicts His Betrayal
When*p Jesus had said this, He became troubled in spirit, and testified and said, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r that*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r Me.”*r
The disciples began*i looking at one another, at a loss to*i know*i of which one He was speaking.
There was reclining on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved.
So Simon Peter gestured to him, and said to him, “Tell us*i who it is of whom He is speaking.”
He, leaning back thus on Jesus’ bosom, said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”

Jesus then answered, “That*r is*r the*r one*r for*r whom*r I*r shall*r dip*r the*r morsel*r and*r give*r it*r to*r him.”*r So when He had dipped the morsel, He took and gave it to Judas, the*i son*i of Simon Iscariot.
After the morsel, Satan then entered into him. Therefore Jesus said to him, “What*r you*r do,*r do*r quickly.”*r
Now no one of those reclining at*i the*i table*i knew for what purpose He had said this to him.
For some were supposing, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus was saying to him, “Buy the things we have need of for the feast”; or else, that he should give something to the poor.
So after receiving the morsel he went out immediately; and it was night.
Therefore*p when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r glorified,*r and*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r Him;*r
if*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r Him,*r God*r will*r also*r glorify*r Him*r in*r Himself,*r and*r will*r glorify*r Him*r immediately.*r

Little*r children,*r I*r am*r with*r you*r a*r little*r while*r longer.*r You*r will*r seek*r Me;*r and*r as*r I*r said*r to*r the*r Jews,*r now*r I*r also*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come.’*r
A*r new*r commandment*r I*r give*r to*r you,*r that*r you*r love*r one*r another,*r even*r as*r I*r have*r loved*r you,*r that*r you*r also*r love*r one*r another.*r
By*r this*r all*r men*r will*r know*r that*r you*r are*r My*r disciples,*r if*r you*r have*r love*r for*r one*r another.”*r
Simon*p Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered, “Where*r I*r go,*r you*r cannot*r follow*r Me*r now;*r but*r you*r will*r follow*r later.”*r
Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You right now? I will lay down my life for You.”
Jesus answered, “Will*r you*r lay*r down*r your*r life*r for*r Me?*r Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r a*r rooster*r will*r not*r crow*r until*r you*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.*r
